newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street shares seen mixed to higher at open.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street shares seen mixed to higher at open.

text.p: U.S. shares are expected to open mixed to slightly firmer on Wednesday, with the recently-strong tech stocks helped by news Microsoft Corp would invest money in Apple Computer Inc.
Sources close to Microsoft said it was set to announce a $150 million investment in Apple Computer. Market watchers said this could add more life to the technology sector.

"It could help the tech stocks," Hildegard Zagorski, an analyst at Prudential Securities, said. "The techs have been flying lately. This is certainly not a negative for tech stocks, though it won't send them flying."
Apple founder Steven Jobs also said he named himself, Oracle Corp Chairman Larry Ellison, Jerry York and Bill Campbell to its board.

But technology stocks would also digest results from giant computer networking equipment maker Cisco Systems, whose fourth quarter earnings were in line with Wall Street estimates but below the so-called "whisper" number.
Blue chip stocks might also struggle to make headway amid a higher interest rate environment, analysts said.
The Standard & Poor's 500 futures index rose 0.30 points to 956.80.
